result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Douglas John Nelson.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Douglas John Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates stayed warrant. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Douglas John Nelson.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appeared earliler. Court waives defendant's appearance. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case was misstabbed to Branch 45. Attorney Darryl Everett Smith is retiring from the case, Attorney William Rakestraw appears and states that he will be taking this case. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court in person with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith who appears by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Douglas John Nelson in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Douglas John Nelson in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Douglas John Nelson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
